title: Cloud Operations Engineer
job_description: Successful candidates for this role have strong troubleshooting instincts honed through hands-on experience supporting large scale cloud-native applications. Your emphasis is solving problems quickly through root cause analysis and resolution evaluation. You are often the go-to source for problem escalation thanks to a deep technical knowledge, strategic needs assessment, the ability to anticipate the ramifications of interventions, and outstanding communications skills.How you will make an impact:Manage system availability, health and service levels of cloud-native applications running in AWSProactively monitor metrics and performance of applications and cloud infrastructureEnsure that response plans, tools, and procedures are updated and validatedTroubleshoot and resolve any issues or incidents that affect the availability, performance or security of our systemsImplement and automate best practices for system configuration, backup, recovery, patching, scaling and securityParticipate in on-call rotation for resolution of issues in a 24x7 cloud environmentDevelop and maintain runbooks and data-driven automated processes and toolsSkills you will need to be successful:Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, MIS, or related technology field, or equivalent practical experience5+ years of experience in AWS cloud operations and infrastructure management, DevOps, SRE3+ years in incident response and major incident managementExpert in tools and procedures to detect and respond to cybersecurity vulnerabilitiesExpert in infrastructure and application monitoring and logging toolsExpert in the management of secrets and access controlsExperienced in containerization and orchestration technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes)Experienced with infrastructure as code (IaC) and configuration management tools. (e.g, Terraform, Ansible)Experience in version control, CI and automation tools such as GitLab, JenkinsExperience configuring, and troubleshooting Database technologiesAbout DEKA:One hour from the beach, Boston, and the mountains, the historic Amoskeag Millyard once housed the largest textile mills in the world. It is now home to DEKA Research and Development, where we are taking the same innovation and cutting-edge technology into the modern age.Behind DEKA’s brick walls sits a team of professionals who strive to make a difference every day through thoughtful engineering, design, and manufacturing. Here at DEKA, some of the most innovative and life-changing products of our time are created, and new ideas are always welcome and explored.

title: Linux Systems/Site Reliability Engineer
job_description: Please note that this position is based on our campus in Madison, WI, and requires relocation to the area. We recruit nationally and provide financial relocation assistance.As a UNIX/Linux systems engineer supporting our internal development and testing systems, you will flex your creativity and technical prowess to support the 9,000+ datacenter-housed systems that help Epic improve healthcare delivery for over 72% of patients in the United States, and around the world.While working on our small, collaborative team of experienced engineers, you'll use analytical and problem-solving skills to take ownership of automation, complex systems architecture projects, and more. Using your creativity and the shared experience of others, you will continuously improve our internal operations and your own depth of technical knowledge.You'll evaluate, develop, and deploy non-traditional solutions, create utility and automation scripts, create/maintain/support Epic's internal and internet-facing systems, and improve monitoring of Epic's internal server environments.Enjoy the perks of being an Epic employee in Madison (check out life at Epic and our culinary team), while working with a broad range of technologies in your day-to-day.More than just important work.Epic is located in Madison, Wisconsin, a city regularly ranked as one of America's best places to live. You'll earn competitive wages and receive benefits befitting a leading software company (401k match, great health insurance, life insurance, performance bonuses and stock grants). Epic's environment is one of continuous learning; you'll have access to opportunities to expand your skill set and share your knowledge with others. Epic is an Equal Opportunity employer. We seek diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences in our mission to improve healthcare. Research has shown that job-seekers who are women, LGBTQ+, or members of the global majority are less likely to apply for roles they don't seem completely qualified for, so we encourage all who are interested to apply. Please see our full non-discrimination statement at https //careers.epic.com/EEO.2+ years' experience administering systems in an enterprise setting supporting production databases or applications.Experience in deployment, monitoring, performance tuning, and troubleshooting in Linux.Experience building tools or automation in languages such as Python or Perl and shell scripting (bash/ksh).Comfort administering virtualized environments with VMware vSphere VMs, AIX LPARs, containers, or similar.Experience with the following is a plus Backup/Restore, Disaster Recovery, DevOps, systems automation.Relocation to the Madison, WI area (reimbursed).Eligible to work in the U.S. without visa sponsorship.COVID-19 vaccination

title: Quality Control Analyst
job_description: About The DepartmentSite New Hampshire, located in West Lebanon, is where Novo Nordisk’s life-saving treatments are brought to life. Our manufacturing facility produces a global supply of our hemophilia and growth hormone product lines, as well as our next generation of cutting-edge medications.What We Offer YouLeading pay and annual performance bonus for all positions36 Paid days off including vacation, sick days & company holidaysHealth Insurance, Dental Insurance, Vision InsuranceGuaranteed 8% 401K contribution plus individual company match option12 weeks Paid Parental LeaveFree access to Novo Nordisk-marketed pharmaceutical productsAt Novo Nordisk, you will find opportunities, resources and mentorship to grow and build your career. Are you ready to realize your potential?The PositionThis position has primary responsibility to support Quality Control (QC) operations in the microbiology or analytical area. This position requires strict adherence to cGMPs, established manufacturing practices and procedures, and compliance with quality regulations and guidelines. This position carries out routine QC testing and may support sampling, investigations, validations, projects and other related support activities for the manufacturing facility and process. This individual works with supervision on routine tasks and detailed instruction on new tasks.This position is located in West Lebanon, NH and will require onsite work and collaboration. It is a full time (40 hour per week) position.We have QC Analyst Levels I-III available depending on experience level.Relationships & ScheduleReports to: QC SupervisorSchedule: Sunday-Thursday or Monday-Friday (8AM-5PM)Essential FunctionsIndependently performs low complexity testing (e.g. Bioburden, Spectroscopy, Environmental Monitoring)Executes moderate complexity testing with minimal support (e.g. Microbial Identification, HPLC)Performs high complexity testing with support (e.g. Bacterial Endotoxin, ELISA, UPLC)Completes routine equipment maintenanceMay support equipment calibration/validation or method verificationParticipates in systematic problem solving and laboratory investigationsMay update standard operating procedures with helpDelivers training on low complexity tasksPerforms troubleshooting with supportContributes to cLEAN activities (e.g. PDCA, SPS, VSM)May lead or support projects with limited scopeDocuments and archives work in accordance with Good Documentation PracticeIdentifies continuous improvement opportunitiesPerforms all job duties and responsibilities in a compliant and ethical manner and in accordance with all applicable healthcare laws, regulations and industry codesIncorporates the Novo Nordisk Way and 10 Essentials in all activities and interactions with othersOther duties as assignedQualificationsBachelors in a scientific discipline, Associates in a scientific discipline (with additional experience) or equivalent level of knowledge, skills and abilitiesBachelor’s with 1 year of related experience or Associates with 2 years of related experience, or equivalentKnowledge of laboratory practices required (such as aseptic technique, use of pipettes, pH etc.)The ability to understand and execute established written instructions is essentialGood organization and documentation skillsStrong Attention to detailAbility to prioritize tasksAbility to train othersPhysical Requirements0-5% overnight travel required. The ability to climb, balance, stoop, reach, stand and walk. The ability to push, lift, grasp, and feel. The ability to speak, listen, and understand verbal and written communication. Repetition including substantial movement of wrists, hands, and or fingers. Lifting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally to lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects. Visual acuity to perform close activities such as: reading, writing, and analyzing; and to determine the accuracy, neatness, and thoroughness of work assigned or to make general observations. The working environment includes a variety of physical conditions including: noise, close proximity to moving parts and equipment, use of ladders, and exposure to chemicals; atmospheric conditions including: odors, fumes, and dust.We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.Novo Nordisk is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by local, state or federal laws, rules or regulations.If you are interested in applying to Novo Nordisk and need special assistance or an accommodation to apply, please call us at 1-855-411-5290. This contact is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

title: Network Growth Business Analyst II
job_description: Who are We? Bottomline is at the forefront of digital transformation. We are a growing global market leader uniquely equipped to address the changing needs of how businesses pay and get paid. Our culture of Working with and for each other enables us to delight our customers. We empower our teams to think like owners driving customer delight, helping them grow their business and win in their markets.Position Summary:We are looking for a Network Growth Business Analyst II to grow with our Team in Portsmouth, NHThe Network Growth Business Analyst II position is an exciting role at a growing company that has been voted one of the best companies to work for in NH for the past 5 years. This individual will play a crucial role in analyzing and interpreting complex data to support strategic decision-making and enhance business processes. The successful candidate will collaborate with cross-functional teams, leveraging analytical skills and industry knowledge to drive improvements in financial products and services. The individual must be able to manage multiple tasks and projects at the same time. This person will be able to work remotely. Preference is for someone who can make occasional visits to our Portsmouth, NH office to work. How you’ll contribute:Perform statistical analysis on large datasets, identifying trends, patterns, insights, and summarizing key findings to internal stakeholders. Utilize statistical models and tools to interpret data and provide actionable recommendations.Lead analysis modeling projects, trainings, and presentations. Collaborate with Paymode-X Business Solutions teams to gather and document detailed business requirements. Evaluate existing business processes and workflows to identify areas for improvement. Work closely with stakeholders to design and implement optimized processes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.Design and create comprehensive reports and dashboards to communicate key performance indicators (KPIs) to relevant stakeholders.Ensure data accuracy and reliability in reporting systems.Work closely with product managers, developers, and other stakeholders to ensure alignment with business goals and drive enhancements to our products and systems.Act as a bridge between technical and non-technical teams to facilitate effective communication.Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of business processes, requirements, and analysis.Driving efficiency and consistency across internal reporting. Research best practices, provides recommendations for the business operations and support developing the solutions.Must be passionate about contributing to an organization focused on continuously improving consumer experiences.The Skills That Will Make You Successful:5 years of experience with reporting and data analysis.Proficiency in data analysis tools: Excel, PowerQuery, PowerBI, Tableau. Power BI strongly preferred.SQL Experience is required.Proficiency in database technologies: Familiarity with database design principles and normalization. Experience with popular relational database management systems such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, SQL Server, or SQLite.Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information to both technical and non-technical audiences.Proven experience as a Business Analyst; strong analytical and project management skills.Ability to meet deadlines and independently manage multiple projects efficiently.Strong team player who is a self-starter and highly motivated, with the ability to take initiative.Exceptional attention to detail and high accuracy.Proactive problem solver with a strategic mindset.Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.Education and Experience:Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business, Economics, Data Analytics, Computer Information Systems, or related fieldIn lieu of the required degree, a minimum of an associate degree and five (5) years of additional relevant work experience is required for this position.You’ll love Bottomline because in everything we do we seek to delight our customers and we are passionate about building a company of which we can all be proud, and this starts with building amazing teams filled with team members that challenge you every day. #LifeAtBottomline

title: Senior Analyst, HR Portfolio Analytics
job_description: Albany International Corporation seeks a Senior Analyst, HR Portfolio Analytics to support our growing business. This role is responsible for partnering with Human Resources teams to provide HR data analytics and insights of people data. Proactively identifies areas of opportunities to align HR strategies with business needs. This person will uncover trends and assist with the development of our predictive analysis strategy while closely partnering with local HR to ensure HR data is accurate and up-to-date. This is an exciting opportunity to join the Albany HRIS team and make an important contribution to the analytics capabilities and fact-based decision making of our company.The Albany HR Team is a world class team focused on these key HR Strategy Levers: Organizational Development, Talent Management, and Organizational Effectiveness. The HRIS team has global responsibilities that focus on four (4) main topics: Compliance, User Experience, Analytics, and Business Requests. These topics? have a direct link to the overall HR Strategy. We partner with local HR to help improve and streamline processes. The HRIS team works cross-functionally, giving this person an opportunity to interact with colleagues across business units and functions at Albany.Albany International Corp. is a global advanced textiles and materials processing company. The products and technologies help make paper smoother, tissue softer, and aircraft engines and structures lighter. The company has two core businesses, The Machine Clothing segment is the world's leading producer of custom-designed fabrics and belts essential to production in the paper, nonwovens, and other process industries and Albany Engineered Composites (AEC) is a rapidly growing supplier of highly engineered composite parts for the aerospace industry.Job PurposeThe ideal candidate will have a background in statistics and previous experience implementing advanced analytical models to identify trends in HR and preparing reports for senior management highlighting key findings.This individual will work diligently to support employees and Human Resources teams with our SAPHR- Assisting with large scale implementation, taking the lead to improve HR efficiency through automation and process improvements. They will be responsible for maintaining our HR Metrics dashboard and assist with the development of Predictive Analytics.The ideal candidate will be a strong communicator, apt in building collaborative and productive relationships within HR and cross functionally. Their strong analytical and research skills will allow them to find and create solutions to solve technical issues, improve processes and user experience. They must be able to run projects and travel to locations.Candidates must possess a minimum of five years of experience in Human Resources, Industrial Organizational Psychology, Data Science, or Statistics.Job ResponsibilitiesResponsible for providing complex data analysis, reporting, metrics, and insights to support the HR Portfolio analytics and business needs. Provides data on trends, benchmarking, predictive modeling, and costing to HR users in a simplistic form. Reviews and complies HR data from multiple sources, to ensure data integrity, consistency, best practices, and usefulness to align with business needs. Prepare monthly and quarterly HR reporting and analyze reporting, identifying trends and/or anomalies warranting additional research.  Develop analytics solutions that are scalable, repeatable, effective, and meet the expectations of the decision-makers and stakeholders. Performs data quality checks using advanced knowledge of HR data to identify data anomalies proactively prior to delivering data to end users. Resolves data integrity issues and escalates problems outside are of expertise. Responsible for working with highly sensitive and confidential information and maintaining the confidentiality of the information used during the normal course of business. Ensures all reporting is maintained according to privacy, confidentiality, and compliance standards. May participate in cross-functional teams and provide recommendations for HR Portfolio analytics.  Perform statistical analysis of workforce data. Analyze and mine data from a variety of sources to identify patterns and correlations among the various data points.  Assist with scale implementations of new systems, upgrades to current systems, and/or new modules of current systems by setting up test users, completing testing scripts, and analyzing results to determine if adjustments are needed prior to go-live Lead implementation meetings both in person and remotely Post go-live support of various systems (SAP HR, SuccessFactors, SharePoint, ATS etc.) Run the weekly payroll processing steps using the SAP CATS system (backup) Make suggestions on how to improve HRIS processes and tools to help optimize technology  Collaborate and partner with Local HR to ensure SAP HR meets the business needs. Assist in adjusting systems, as new specs are required. Examples include: gathering specs for: work schedules, overtime rules, paid-time-off rules for vacation, hourly PTO, etc. This is an onsite position with 25% travel required, domestic and international.Experience/Education/Skills Bachelor's degree in HR, IT, or business5+ years of experience with SAP, Oracle, or other large ERP Systems Experience with analyzing and reporting data in order to identify issues, trends, or exceptions to drive improvement of results and find solutions.  Knowledge of HR metrics (e.g., turnover, headcount, etc.) Expert skill in Microsoft Excel (for example: vlookup, macro workbook, pivot table, strong understanding of Excel functions & formulas).  Expert level skill in Microsoft PowerPoint (for example: create tables, graphs, and analytics) Intermediate level of Microsoft Word  Deep understanding of mathematics and ability to make conceptual connection with data  Strong Analytical abilities, strong planning abilities Continuous learner and willing to research issues Strong sense of urgency  Desire to solve problems and come up with creative solutions Adaptive personal style, strong interpersonal skills Strong team player Business acumen and communication skills Exposure to working in a global environment preferred  US Citizens and those authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply; we are unable to sponsor at this time.

title: DevOps Engineer - (cloud environments - TS/SC clearance)
job_description: BAE Systems has a job opening for a Software Engineering Tools DevOps administrator. As a key member of the Software Engineering Tools team, the DevOps administrator will work closely with the Platform Engineering (PE) group that manages an on-premises Virtual Cloud Computing Center (VC3).The Software Engineering Tools team seeks a motivated DevOps Technical Support Administrator to tackle the task of automating reliable, sustainable, and optimized services for bringing modernized, cloud native compute technologies into closed area environments ranging from large, multi-site networks to small air-gapped environments. Your efforts on our cloud-based systems ensures application security, scalability, and reliability across multiple security enclaves to support the Software Engineering Digital Ecosystem. Your experience and passion for DevOps practices and tools will be essential in automating processes, streamlining deployments, providing disaster recovery and improving the overall efficiency of our services.Key Responsibilities:Act as the focal point for bringing modernized, cloud native compute technologies into BAE closed area environments.Collaborate with the Platform Engineering and Closed Room Operations/Infrastructure teams to define infrastructure requirements, understand application needs, optimize system performance, scalability, and reliability.Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines for seamless application deployment and continuous integration using industry-standard tools and frameworks.Work in closed area environments to deploy tools and train administrators on support and operations activities.Automate infrastructure provisioning, configuration management, and monitoring using tools such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef, or similar technologies.Monitor system performance, conduct root cause analysis, and implement optimizations to enhance system availability, reliability, and efficiency.Troubleshoot and resolve production incidents related to performance, availability, infrastructure, networking, and application deployment in a timely manner.Provide close coordination with security -- ISSE’s, ISSM’s, ISSO’s -- ensuring compliance and auditability.Participate in service improvement initiatives, including identifying opportunities for service optimization and cost reduction.Stay up to date with emerging technologies, industry trends, and best practices in DevOps to continuously improve the infrastructure and development processes.Work with Engineering to refine requirements into an IT plan related to modernization and DevOps needs to include modernized workloads, cloud native computing, on premise cloud, containerization, etc.Create and maintain documentation for engineering application installations and upgrades.Assist with incident response and problem management to minimize service downtime and ensure swift recovery from interruptions.Support users in a timely manner using ServiceNow Help Desk ticketing system.Ensure compliance with security and regulatory requirements.The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of delivering high-quality services in a cloud-based ecosystem and will be able to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.The DevOps Administrator will have an understanding of cloud infrastructure and the ability to bridge between development and operations. The Software Engineering Tools team believes in investing in our professionals. Training time and opportunities are available to increase skills and keep knowledge cutting edge.Required Skills:Ability to obtain a Secret clearance and CompTIA Security+ or equivalent certification within 6 months of hireProven experience as a DevOps Engineer or a similar roleKnowledge of on-premises cloud infrastructure technologies, such as OpenStack, VMware, or Azure StackProficiency in scripting and automation using languages like Python, Bash, or PowerShellStrong understanding of cloud services including virtualization, containerization, and related architectural principlesFamiliarity with automation toolkits such as Ansible, Terraform, or PackerHands-on experience with CI/CD tools like GitLab and understand version control and git workflowsUnderstanding of networking concepts, TCP/IP, DNS, load balancing, and firewall configurationKnowledge of Linux/Unix systems administration and troubleshootingFamiliarity with monitoring tools and frameworks (e.g., Nagios, Prometheus, ELK stack)Working experience with Kubernetes and other containerization technologiesOccasional off-hour response to outages and subsequent service restoration effortsExcellent communication and interpersonal skills, including the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholdersStrong understanding of security and regulatory compliance requirementsDemonstrated problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to work effectively in a teamExhibit sound judgement, initiative and self-motivation and able to complete tasks with minimal supervisionClose collaboration with peers, Platform Engineering, Engineering, various stakeholders and managers is essentialPreferredA Security+ or equivalent certificationExperience deploying SaaS and PaaS services for use by other usersHaving a TS/SC clearanceExperience working in a customer service organization to resolve issues experienced by usersKubernetes certifications such as CKAD, CKA, or CKSConducting zero downtime Kubernetes upgrades5 years of experience as a DevOps Engineer or similar role with on-premise cloud environmentsJob ID# 100582BR
Industries: Aviation and Aerospace Component Manufacturing and Defense and Space Manufacturing

title: Security Systems Engineer
job_description: 2089985-1Job DescriptionAs a Security Systems Engineer, you will work as a member of the Fidelity Security Technology Team. You will be responsible for assisting in the design and implementation of physical security for various Fidelity Properties. The ideal candidate will demonstrate an understanding of the security business or function and display an understanding of how hardware/software systems relate to the protection of Fidelity sites.The TeamThe Fidelity Corporate Security Group is seeking a team member who has demonstrated experience delivering creative solutions to complex issues within a collaborative and cooperative environment. Our team is passionate about Global Security and Investigation’s Mission - “Protect Fidelity’s assets: our reputation, our people, our clients and our vital business information, processes and facilities.” We offer a flexible work environment with exceptional compensation packages and industry leading benefits. This outstanding opportunity is critical to advancing Fidelity Investments’ Security Technology and will also have impacts throughout the security industry.The Expertise And Skills You BringBS degree in Computer Science or equivalent degree or work experience preferred5+ years of technology experience in the implementation and integration of software solutions in highly scalable environmentsExperience with all aspects of Physical Security including Video Surveillance, Access Control, and IntrusionHands-on system integration experience is preferredExperience with design tool and programs such as AutoCAD, Revit, and VisioUnderstanding of cloud-based solutions, continuous integration/deployment, and cloud architecture.Desire and skills for learning new technologiesPrevious experience using business requirements to develop technical designs and define architectural strategies and solutionsAbility to communicate problems and recommend solutions to team membersExcellent verbal and written communication skillsWorking across cloud infrastructure components (server, storage, network, data, and applications).Participate and maintain the Technical Security standards globally and ensure flawless internal testing and control to ensure baseline standards are adhered to and maintainedParticipate in working groups to address Technical Security operations, strategies, risks, and product support as neededSupport the implementation of strong governance structures for all Technical Security platforms and operationsFamiliarity of the following Technical Security and Security Engineering topics preferred:Physical Access ControlElectronic Access Control SystemsVisitor Management SystemsAccess Control Devices & EquipmentVideo SurveillanceVideo Management Systems (VMS)Internet Protocol Video (IPV)Video Content Analysis Systems (VCA)Digital & Analog Platform TopologiesVideo Surveillance Devices & EquipmentIntrusion DetectionAlarm Monitoring Systems (AMS)Physical Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS)Intrusion Detection Devices & EquipmentThreat PreventionFingerprint Authentication SystemsCryptographic Key Management Systems (CKMS)Security Operations CenterPhysical Security Information Management (PSIM)Central Monitoring Station (CMS)Integrated Platform Design & ArchitectureCertificationsCompany OverviewFidelity Investments is a privately held company with a mission to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients’ money.Join UsAt Fidelity, you’ll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples’ lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. Honored with a Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, we have been recognized by our employees as a top 10 Best Place to Work in 2024. And you don’t need a finance background to succeed at Fidelity—we offer a range of opportunities for learning so you can build the career you’ve always imagined.Fidelity's working model blends the best of working offsite with maximizing time together in person to meet associate and business needs. Currently, most hybrid roles require associates to work onsite all business days of one assigned week per four-week period (beginning in September 2024, the requirement will be two full assigned weeks).At Fidelity, we value honesty, integrity, and the safety of our associates and customers within a heavily regulated industry. Certain roles may require candidates to go through a preliminary credit check during the screening process. Candidates who are presented with a Fidelity offer will need to go through a background investigation, detailed in this document, and may be asked to provide additional documentation as requested. This investigation includes but is not limited to a criminal, civil litigations and regulatory review, employment, education, and credit review (role dependent). These investigations will account for 7 years or more of history, depending on the role. Where permitted by federal or state law, Fidelity will also conduct a pre-employment drug screen, which will review for the following substances: Amphetamines, THC (marijuana), cocaine, opiates, phencyclidine.We invite you to Find Your Fidelity at fidelitycareers.com.Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, contact the HR Accommodation Team by sending an email to accommodations@fmr.com, or by calling 800-835-5099, prompt 2, option 3.

title: 12Y Geospatial Engineer
job_description: You can play an important part in disaster relief missions as a Geospatial Engineer for the Army National Guard. In this role, you will extract and supply geographic data that supports military operations of all kinds and help commanders visualize the battlefield during combat.As a Geospatial Engineer, your primary responsibility will be to collect and process military geographic information from decentralized sources (remote sensed imagery, digital data, intelligence data, existing topographic products, and other collateral data sources), present this information to leaders, and return decisions to the field.You May Also Supervise topographic surveying, cartography, and photolithography activities Assist in topographic planning and control activities Assist in determining requirements and providing technical supervision of geographic intelligence programsJob Duties Create geographic data and compile them into maps Create and maintain multiple geospatial databases Prepare military-style briefs covering all aspects of the terrainSome Of The Skills You’ll Learn Basic knowledge of Geographic Information Systems Imagery interpretation and exploitationHelpful Skills Interest in geography, maps, and charts Ability to demonstrate basic computer skills and work with drafting equipment Conceptualize ideas into computer-generated 2-D/3-D geospatial products Preference for a technical career fieldThrough your training, you will develop the skills and experience to enjoy a civilian career with construction, engineering, and architectural firms, as well as with government agencies as a surveyor, mapmaker, cartographer, cartographic technician, or photogrammetrist.Earn While You LearnInstead of paying to learn these skills, get paid to train. In the Army National Guard, you will learn these valuable job skills while earning a regular paycheck and qualifying for tuition assistance.Job training for a Geospatial Engineer requires 10 weeks of Basic Training, where you'll learn basic Soldiering skills, and 20 weeks of Advanced Individual Training (AIT) and on-the-job instruction, including practical application of geographic information systems. Part of this time is spent in the classroom and part in the field.
Industries: Construction, Industrial Machinery Manufacturing, and Civil Engineering

title: Quantitative Analysis Intern (Finance)
job_description: Sprague is passionate about delivering the diverse products and programs that warm, power and move the world. We keep homes warm through Northeastern winters and hospitals cool through summer. We help small businesses focus on serving their communities, and our renewable fuels keep our country’s infrastructure running. From importing wind energy components to deploying leading-edge solar technology to help power terminal facilities, we are committed to continually evolving to meet our customers’ changing energy needs.Sprague is looking for a Quantitative Analysis Intern (Quant. Finance Track) for Summer 2024. This position will support the Quant. Analysis and Portfolio Mgmt. team within Sprague’s Retail Natural Gas and Electricity BU in the areas of developing quantitative finance solutions and applications. We are seeking upbeat and energetic candidates with excellent communication and collaboration skills, who thrive on challenges and are excited about the idea of working in a high growth, fast-paced organization in the energy sector. The intern(s) will work with assigned supervisors / subject experts from the Quant. Analysis and Portfolio Mgmt. team and will interact with other members of the Retail Energy BU and other Sprague Energy teams as well as present project results and receive feedback from the management team.This position will be based out of our Portsmouth, NH office (Hybrid is an option).A successful intern candidate will apply and develop skills in various areas of quantitative finance analysis and applications (stochastic processes applied to pricing, hedging and optimization, Monte Carlo simulations, parameter estimations, modeling of volatility and correlations, model calibrations, model deployment), while supporting and learning from energy industry professionals in the areas of energy markets, retail natural gas and electricity products and services, data science, analytics, forecasting, modeling business and product risks, portfolio and asset optimization, risk management and economic analysis.The Intern will also learn about and contribute to building, cleaning, testing, and working with various databases, data processes and quantitative analysis models, tools, and applications. (on prem and cloud)Please include a resume and cover letter explaining why you would like to pursue this internship, and skills, courses and projects that make you a good fit for the Quantitative analysis internship.*Potential project areas:Energy asset optimization, pricing, and hedging (storage, pipeline capacity, other assets modeling). Assist in developing and deploying energy commodity prices simulation models and libraries. Assist in developing and improving product risks hedging strategies on standalone and portfolio level. Help improve models and estimates for exchange clearing margin account interest costs. Help develop and improve ETRM systems’ quantitative analytics. Support the Quantitative analysis team in various projects as required by the business. We want to hear from you!Do you like to solve problems and consider yourself forward thinking? If you are looking for an internship to challenge yourself while working for a complex and exciting industry, then Sprague is your place. Sprague employees are dedicated and driven. We work best as a team, knowing that collaboration leads to innovation and the best customer experience. We are looking for hardworking colleagues to join us and help us stay at the forefront of the energy industry, which is where we’ve been for the last 150 years.Qualified candidates for this role will have the following: Education: Progressing towards a Master’s degree in Quantitative Finance, Financial Mathematics, Computational Finance, Mathematical Finance, or such recent graduates looking to start an Internship to learn and apply their skills in the Energy industry. Candidates from other quantitative majors like Econometrics, Applied Mathematics, Data Science, Actuary Science, etc., with extensive advanced coursework in quantitative finance subjects like Stochastic Calculus, Hedging and Derivatives instruments, Monte Carlo simulations, Stochastic Optimization would also be considered. Passionate for applying quantitative skills in a business environment to create and drive business and customers insights, decisions, actions and added value. Advanced programming and model deployment skills in languages like R, Python, MATLAB,Advanced data manipulation (SQL, Python, etc) and data modeling skills. Some exposure to cloud computing, parallel computing, and machine learning applications in cloud environments like AWS will be a plus. Ability to solve complex problems and conduct research as needed; see projects through toStrong interest in learning about the energy markets and as a potential career path. Strong drive to learn and share knowledge with others, effective interpersonal skills, attention to details and accuracy, while able to see the biggerVery strong collaborative skills and teamwork oriented. Aptitude for developing creative solutions and thinking outside the box. Ability to remain positive and focused on finding solutions when facing various challenges. Following the highest standards of ethics and respect for individuals and the work environment is aAbility to cover various tasks from supporting coworkers with data preparation and modeling to independent deeper quantitative analysis and modeling work and resultsWho we are:Sprague takes a collaborative, customer-centric approach to providing best-in-class energy products and related services throughout the Northeast. Founded in 1870, we pride ourselves on offering customers the expert solutions and high-quality service that help their businesses thrive in any market landscape. Sprague values innovation, safety, integrity and people. We know that our people are what set us apart from our competition, and we work hard to make sure each employee across our 20+ locations knows how important they are to our community.What we offer:We recently surveyed our employees to ask them their favorite part of the job. They answered, "The people I work with."In addition to great coworkers, Sprague has adopted a casual business dress code where you can wear jeans to work! Do you want to get involved where you work? Is giving back important to you? It’s important to us, too! Sprague donates back to the communities in which we live and work every year, and provides opportunities for employees to support various charities throughout the year. Sprague has a range of committees to support varying initiatives (Sustainability, Charitable, Scholarship, Innovation, FunForce, etc.). Sprague is a place that cares about its employees, its community, and about creating a place where people want to come to work every day.Come join us to learn why we are consistently celebrating 20-, 30-, and even 40-year anniversaries here at Sprague! Sprague is an EEO/AA employer. We strongly encourages minorities, females, Vets and individuals with disabilities to apply.As a federal contractor we adhere to OFCCP employment regulations. Click here for OFCCP compliance information

title: System Security Engineer
job_description: Job Description Our Charter: Deter. Prevent. Detect. Respond.Our Mission: Safeguard the United States' most critical technologies from exploitation to maintain our battlefield pre-eminence.Our Need: Creative and innovative engineers with prior systems, hardware, or software engineering experience with interest in security and the drive to out think world class reverse engineers.In a modern approach to “Spy vs Spy,” BAE Systems uses state-of-the-art technology, advanced mathematics, and physics in novel ways to protect our systems and provide our customers with capability that endures.Our system security engineers design solutions that achieve the optimum balance between product capability and defense-in-depth security. They apply all the lessons learned to our model-based design approach and frequently advance security state-of-the-art. They take their creative and innovative spirit to the extreme by playing the part of adversary through their identification of attack vectors. They propose countermeasures that provide the greatest protection at the best value for the system’s entire lifecycle.BAE Systems is currently seeking creative, innovative problem solvers who are able to analyze, assess, anticipate, defend, and react to current and future attacks. Candidates should be capable of working in a team environment designing and implementing innovative protection schemes with rapidly evolving technologies used in various applications throughout the company.BAE Systems’ salary and benefits include 401(k) matching, employee discount programs, and work schedule flexibility such as alternating Fridays off. $156860Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. title: Software Test Engineer

job_description: Please note that this position is based on our campus in Madison, WI, and requires relocation to the area. We recruit nationally and provide financial relocation assistance.As a Windows Server Engineer you'll install, configure, and support a variety of Microsoft technologies in Epic's infrastructure. Epic's Windows Server team is responsible for day-to-day operations, as well as ongoing architecture for Active Directory, SQL Server, Office 365, Azure, Citrix, Splunk, Exchange, Windows Containers, Hyper-V, and much more. You'll have the opportunity to explore new versions of operating systems, provisioning systems, and developing creative and clever solutions to meet internal and external infrastructure needs.Using automation tools, you will create utility and automation scripts for Windows fleet management for both on-prem and cloud resources. You will work with Epic's development teams to improve and maintain their deployment processes. You will improve monitoring of Epic's Microsoft infrastructure using Splunk, SentryOne, Prometheus, and other monitoring systems.More than just important work.Epic is located in Madison, Wisconsin, a city regularly ranked as one of America's best places to live. Epic's environment is one of continuous learning; you'll have access to opportunities to expand your skill set and share your knowledge with others. We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. Epic is an Equal Opportunity employer. We seek diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences in our mission to improve healthcare. Research has shown that job-seekers who are women, LGBTQ+, or members of the global majority are less likely to apply for roles they don't seem completely qualified for, so we encourage all who are interested to apply. Please see our full non-discrimination statement at https //careers.epic.com/EEO.Relocation to the Madison, WI area (reimbursed)Proficiency with current versions of Windows ServerExposure to Scripting or programmingStrong troubleshooting skills and excellent customer serviceEligibility to work in the U.S. without visa sponsorshipCOVID-19 vaccination

title: SYSTEM DEVELOPMENT SPECIALIST VI
job_description: State of New Hampshire Job PostingDEPARTMENT OF INFORMATION TECHNOLOGYBusiness Relationship Management Division - Dept of Revenue Administration109 Pleasant St.Pay Range $33.47 - $45.72 HOURLYSYSTEM DEVELOPMENT SPECIALIST VIPosition #18965See total compensation information at the bottom of announcement. The State of New Hampshire, Department of Information Technology, Business Relationship Management Division - Dept of Revenue Administration has a full time vacancy for a Systems Development Specialist VI.SCOPE OF WORK : Works as lead application development specialist with DRA and outside vendors with respect to application design for the Department of Revenue. Performs analysis, design and translation of programming functions to implement automated solutions to business processes.ACCOUNTABILITIES :Provides guidance, advice and direction to project team members, while demonstrating solid understanding of all programming concepts in order to successfully oversee the quality and design integrity of all assigned programming and system development activities, Designs, creates and documents functional, system and program specifications in support of the Department of Revenue Administration.Demonstrates knowledge of relational databases, data structures, and standard development techniques (SQL, VB.net) in order to analyze and prepare systems change impact assessments for service requests, program/policy changes, audit findings, and to evaluate software enhancement requests; performs risk analysis as needed and works with business users and consulting team to implement system changes.Creates and develops application design specifications, for use by other Systems Development Specialist’s, to enhance current automated systems and to support user needs.Oversee the quality and design integrity of application systems and enhancements including analysis, coding, testing, debugging, test data preparation, implementations and documentation in accordance with division standards.Interfaces with developers, vendors, subject matter experts, project managers and senior level stakeholders in a professional, positive manner in order to supports major system and application design and maintenance initiatives for the Department of Revenue Administration and assists with the development of project plans.Maintain in depth, working knowledge of the department’s critical, large and complex Tax Information Management Systems.Provides technical expertise to maintain system software, analyze problems, and monitor system to ensure the availability of system to end users.Works closely with the team throughout the development life-cycle, translating business metrics and goals, while providing guidance around requirements gathering, scoping, solution development, deployment and documentation in order to maintain system.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:Education : Bachelor's degree from a recognized college or university with at least fifteen (15) credit hours in the field of computer sciences. Each additional year of approved formal education may be substituted for one year of required work experience.Experience : Six years' experience as a computer programmer or systems analyst associated with a late generation medium or large scale on-line computer systems or computer networks similar to the recruiting agency; at least three years of which shall have been involved with systems analysis. Each additional year of approved work experience may be substituted for one year of required formal education.License/Certification : Must be eligible to hold a valid New Hampshire driver's license and have access to transportation for use in statewide travel.SPECIAL QUALIFICATIONS: Must have experience in C# programming, use of SQL database and stored procedures in a Windows environment and the ability to work in a team environment is required. Must demonstrate in-depth understanding of all programming concepts, including flowcharting, analysis, coding, testing, documenting, and implementing programs and systems.RECOMMENDED WORK TRAITS: Knowledge of current methods of computer systems analysis and design. Knowledge of management principles and practices and their relationship to computerization. Knowledge of the principles of computer programming and the capabilities and requirements of information systems. Knowledge of the application and use of peripheral computer-related equipment. Ability to explain technical operations in easily understood language for non-technical personnel. Ability to supervise and train project resources in the processes used in converting systems to electronic data processing. Ability to communicate effectively, orally and in writing. Ability to analyze operations and organize their component parts into a logical system. Ability to coordinate the conversion of agency programs to information processing systems. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with subordinates, associates, agency management officials, project resources, as well as personnel associated with professional organizations. Must be willing to maintain appearance appropriate to assigned duties and responsibilities as determined by the agency appointing authority.DISCLAIMER STATEMENT: The supplemental job description lists the essential functions of the position and is not intended to include every job duty and responsibility specific to the position. An employee may be required to perform other related duties not listed on the supplemental job description provided that such duties are characteristic of that classification.For further information please contact Karen Sampson, IT Manager (603) 230-5990Selected candidate will undergo a fingerprint-based criminal background check and motor vehicle record check in order to ensure suitability for exposure to confidential information.TOTAL COMPENSATION INFORMATION The State of NH total compensation package features an outstanding set of employee benefits, including:HMO or POS Medical and Prescription Drug Benefits: The actual value of State-paid health benefits is based on the employee¿s union status, and employee per pay period health benefit contributions will vary depending on the type of plan selected.See this link for details on State-paid health benefits: https://das.nh.gov/hr/benefits.htmlValue of State's share of Employee's Retirement:13.85% of payOther Benefits:  Dental Plan at minimal cost for employees and their families ($500-$1800 value) Flexible Spending healthcare and childcare reimbursement accounts State defined benefit retirement plan and Deferred Compensation 457(b) plan Work/life balance flexible schedules, paid holidays and generous leave plan $50,000 state-paid life insurance plus additional low cost group life insurance Incentive-based Wellness Program (ability to earn up to $500)Total Compensation Statement Worksheet: https://das.nh.gov/documents/hr/JobSearch/FINAL_TOTAL_COMP_STATEMENT_ISSUE.xlsxWant the specifics?Explore the Benefits of State Employment on our website:https://das.nh.gov/hr/documents/BenefitBrochure.pdfhttps://das.nh.gov/hr/index.aspxEOETDD Access: Relay NH 1-800-735-2964

title: Test Engineer
job_description: GENTEX AT A GLANCE:At Gentex Corporation, we’ve created an environment where great ideas and great people can thrive. Leveraging a history that spans over 125 years, Gentex is a global leader in personal protection and situational awareness solutions for defense forces, emergency responders, and industrial personnel operating in high performance environments. Join our multinational team of exceptional and dedicated employees around the world and work on challenging and rewarding projects, grow your skills, and advance your career all while making a positive difference in the lives of our customers. Together, you and Gentex can build a career that’s uniquely yours.ABOUT THE JOB!The position is responsible for the creation, maintenance, development, and support of production test equipment, procedures, and software for Gentex-manufactured products for the Situational Awareness Value Stream. Gentex offers a robust benefit package- including, but not limited to, medical coverages, 401k, paid time off and excellent work schedules including a 9/80 work week.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:B.S. Electrical Engineering 5 years’ experience in test or electrical engineering role. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:Test development in a manufacturing environment. Acoustic test experience KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:Deep working knowledge of: o Electronics and product testing methods o Debug and Troubleshooting of electronic systems o MATLAB software development platform; LabView experience is a pluso Database query and build for test data management and report generation a pluso Manufacturing test limit generation and alignment to product performanceExcellent oral & written communication skillsTeam focused with the ability to participate in cross-functional teamsBasic understanding of metrology techniques and interpretation of mechanical drawings Basic knowledge with Process Control tools, and statistical techniques. Gage R&R or similar Measurement System Analysis experience preferred Familiarity with Quality Management System standards such as ISO 9001 or AS9100 preferredCapable of soldering and basic mechanical skills for assembly and maintenance of test fixturesTestStand experience a plusGit repository experience a plusESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Develop and maintain electrical and acoustic test fixtures and software operating on Audio Precision, and National Instruments (LabView, MATLAB) platforms. Develop and maintain manufacturing test limits based on performance specifications and/or statistical analysis of manufacturing dataCollaborate with suppliers and contract manufacturers for development or support of production test fixtures, software, and equipmentTransition new test equipment and process into production; either in-house or at a contract manufacturer’s facilityImplement and maintain test databases and generate report queries to adequately track manufacturing yieldCreate, develop and maintain production test process and instructionsCreate test plans, coordinate and carry out testing, analyze data, and generate engineering/qualification reportsSupport production with failure analysis of printed circuit boards, product assemblies, test fixtures, and test equipment Participate in New Product Development to provide design input and guidance for manufacturability and testability of components and productsTrain personnel on product testing, equipment repair, and maintenance as requiredReport regularly on project status and progress, especially noting variance from baseline projections.TO APPLY:Visit: https://gentexcorp.com/careers/LOCATION:Gentex’s Manchester facility is located in southern New Hampshire. Manchester is the largest convention, sports, entertainment, and arts & cultural destination in New Hampshire. There is so much to do, see and experience in Manchester including major concerts and ECHL Hockey, AA minor league baseball, live performances at the historic Palace Theatre or exhibits at our renowned museums. Located in the heart of New England, Manchester is also conveniently located within an hour’s drive of Boston, an hour from the Atlantic Ocean and less than two hours from New Hampshire’s scenic White Mountains, Lake Winnipesaukee and the many other well-known vacation destinations in Maine, Vermont and Massachusetts.At Gentex, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Gentex Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their protected veteran status or on the basis of disability. Gentex is an E-Verify Participant. Pre-employment drug/alcohol/background screening is required. If you have a disability and would like to request an accommodation in order to apply for a position with Gentex, please call our Human Resources department at (570) 282-3550.

title: Computer Numerical Control Programmer
job_description: CNC Programmer I, II, IIICompetitive Pay, $10,000 SIGN ON Bonus Our client is a leading provider and manufacturer of firearms, electro-optics, ammunition, airguns, suppressors, remote controlled weapons stations, and training. For over 250 years our client has evolved, and thrived, by blending American ingenuity, German engineering, and Swiss precision. Today, our client is synonymous with industry-leading quality and innovation which has made it the brand of choice amongst the U.S. Military, the global defense community, law enforcement, competitive shooters, hunters, and responsible citizens. Additionally, our client is the premier provider of elite firearms instruction and tactical training at their Academy. Headquartered in Newington, New Hampshire, our client has over 3,200 employees across twelve locations in three states and is a certified Great Place to Work™. Hiring immediately for CNC Programmers to provide programming set up and machining expertise in support of daily production in Rochester, NH and Exeter, NH. Must have 3+ yrs experience CNC Programming with CAM software (GibbsCam or MasterCam) and operating CNC equipment.Must have experience programming 4, & 5-axis mills, Swiss, and/or mill/turn machines.Job Duties & ResponsibilitiesIndependently create CNC programs using GibbsCAM or MasterCam.Experience in programming 4, & 5-axis mills, Swiss, and/or mill/turn machines.Configure tools and ensure efficient production.Identify, design and manufacture fixturing and work holding to effectively process parts through all operations.Analyze blueprints to calculate correct part dimensions for tool selection, machine speeds, and feed rates.Independently set up and operate CNC equipment on first run parts before handing off to production.Diagnose and troubleshoot quality and/or process related issues.Provide guidance to operators and setup technicians for process related issues.Provide cycle time and tooling cost estimates for new products to engineering.Communicate recommendations to engineers to modify parts and processes.Carry out other duties reasonable within capability as required by the supervisor.Education And/or ExperienceHigh School or GED Diploma required - associate degree or Certification in related field preferred.At least 3 years of experience with CNC programming with CAM software, and operating CNC equipment.Use precision measuring instruments including micrometers and calipers, fixtures, and gauges to check work.Read Instrumentation and gauges (micro heights, micrometers, calipers, etc) to accurately measure dimensions on parts that are being machined.Must have a proficient understanding of G-code and M-code programming.Able to demonstrate good manufacturing practices and be able to select tooling and machining resources for the manufacture of parts.Strong mathematical skills.Blueprint with GD&T reading capabilities.Able to work under own initiative.Flexible, courteous, friendly, and positive approach.Discretion, confidentiality, and professionalism at all times.Ability to follow written and verbal instructions.Ability to work in a team environment.Make a positive contribution to maintaining a workplace that is safe, neat, and tidy.Working ConditionsOn-Site work in either in Rochester, NH or Exeter, NHAble to lift up to 40 pounds.Must wear Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) which is required in designated areas.Why Choose our client? Compensation and Financial Benefits:Competitive PayAnnual Employee Bonus401k from Day 1, employer match at 100% for first 4% contribution, 50% match on next 2%Short Term/Long Term Disability InsuranceLife Insurance & AD&DProfessional Growth and Development:Career Advancement OpportunitiesComprehensive Training ProgramsTuition ReimbursementLicense to access online Training platform Health and Wellness:Medical, Dental, & Vision Insurance (starts following 30 days of employment)Vacation TimeSick TimePaid Holidays3 Floating Holidays2 Service/Volunteer Days Employee Perks:Employee Firearm PURCHASE or GIFT ProgramDiscountsUNLIMITED Classes at the client’s Academy in Epping, NH, 50% discount for spouse/partners& Family DiscountsPrescription Safety Glass ReimbursementSafety Shoe ReimbursementGym – Corporate HQplace to work certified employer

title: Senior Windows Server Engineer
job_description: Please note that this position is based on our campus in Madison, WI, and requires relocation to the area. We recruit nationally and provide financial relocation assistance.As a Windows Server Engineer you'll install, configure, and support a variety of Microsoft technologies in Epic's infrastructure. Epic's Windows Server team is responsible for day-to-day operations, as well as ongoing architecture for Active Directory, SQL Server, Office 365, Azure, Citrix, Splunk, Exchange, Windows Containers, Hyper-V, and much more. You'll have the opportunity to explore new versions of operating systems, provisioning systems, and developing creative and clever solutions to meet internal and external infrastructure needs.Using automation tools, you will create utility and automation scripts for Windows fleet management for both on-prem and cloud resources. You will work with Epic's development teams to improve and maintain their deployment processes. You will improve monitoring of Epic's Microsoft infrastructure using Splunk, SentryOne, Prometheus, and other monitoring systems.More than just important work.Epic is located in Madison, Wisconsin, a city regularly ranked as one of America's best places to live. Epic's environment is one of continuous learning; you'll have access to opportunities to expand your skill set and share your knowledge with others. We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. Epic is an Equal Opportunity employer. title: Senior Endpoint Engineer/Intune Specialist
job_description: Locations: ; Remote, FL, United States of America; Placeholder, GA, United States of America; Placeholder, CO, United States of America; Remote, OH, United States of America; Placeholder, MA, United States of America; Placeholder, VA, United States of America; Placeholder, NH, United States of America; Placeholder, NC, United States of America; Placeholder, SC, United States of AmericaCorporateAt ZOLL, we're passionate about improving patient outcomes and helping save lives.We provide innovative technologies that make a meaningful difference in people's lives. Our medical devices, software and related services are used worldwide to diagnose and treat patients suffering from serious cardiopulmonary and respiratory conditions.Job SummaryThe Senior Endpoint Engineer will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining our global, enterprise endpoint solutions, ensuring optimal performance, security, and scalability. Working closely with our End User Services organization, our end users, and other team members in a collaborative, user centric, transparent, innovative, and supportive way, this person will enable our business by ensuring that all endpoint devices, including workstations, laptops, mobile devices, virtual, and other endpoints, are secure, compliant, and operate efficiently within our organization.Essential FunctionsDesign, test, validate and implement large scale, enterprise endpoint solutions, including device configurations, operating system deployments, and software distribution.Document environments, configurations, deployments, and changes within the environment.Develop and maintain endpoint security standards in line with the company's security policies and best practices.Create standardized desktop and laptop configurations, including operating systems and software, and ensure the deployment feasibility of these configurations to new or existing hardware. Ensure that the imaging infrastructure is being utilized successfully across the estate through regular monitoring and regular touchpoints with End User Services. Respond to, investigate, and resolve issues with the imaging infrastructure in a timely manner.Develop standards and guidelines for the adoption of new technologies, ensuring consistency, compatibility, and security within the organization’s endpoint computing environment. Establish schedules for regular technology reviews.Define and enforce group policies to control and configure endpoint settings, permissions, and access controls.Manage virtualized endpoints for efficient endpoint delivery and management, working with End User Services to ensure that all services meet end user needs on a regular basis.Oversee the deployment, management, and administration of endpoint management platforms such as Intune, SCCM, and JAMF for endpoints using Windows, MacOS, iOS, and Android.Analyze, report, and act upon endpoint performance metrics and security alerts.Monitor endpoint performance, identify bottlenecks, and optimize configurations for better user experience. Work closely with End User Services to ensure user experience is being measured on a consistent basis through ticketing trends, proactive working groups with stakeholders across the company, and other feedback such as surveys and metrics.Ensure that all endpoints are compliant with licensing, security patches, and company policies.Research and evaluate new endpoint technologies, tools, and solutions to improve efficiency and security. In close collaboration with End User Services and other IT leadership, develop standards and guidelines for the adoption of new technologies.Actively participate in conferences, workshops, and training to ensure our practices are in line with industry advancements.Host regular sessions with internal teams to disseminate knowledge of technologies and best practices.Ensure pilot program success to test the feasibility and compatibility of new technologies with the organization’s existing infrastructure.Lead endpoint-related projects, ensuring timely delivery and alignment with business objectives.Function as a subject matter expert for endpoint management, providing escalated support and troubleshooting for complex endpoint issues.Required/Preferred Education And ExperienceBachelor's Degree Information Technology, Computer Science preferred5+ years of experience in endpoint engineering or management in a global, large scale enterprise environment. requiredKnowledge, Skills And AbilitiesExpertise in endpoint management tools and technologies required (SCCM, Intune, JAMF) using MAM/MDM administration.Expertise in operating systems such as Windows 10/11, MacOS, LinuxProficiency in a scripting language such as PowerShell as well as Group Policy managementKnowledge of networking protocolsStrong understanding of endpoint security best practices and threat landscape.Exceptional problem solving and decision making abilities.Strong interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal.Experience mentoring technical colleagues.Physical DemandsThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.Standing - OccasionallyWalking - OccasionallySitting - ConstantlyTalking - OccasionallyHearing - OccasionallyRepetitive Motions - FrequentlySalary for this position is $110K-$115K base salary annually. Final compensation will be determined by various factors such as a candidate's relevant work experience, skills, certifications, and location.If you would like to be considered for this role, we are asking that all applicants please apply by the end of the day on Friday, April 26, 2024.Perks & BenefitsZOLL provides a casual work environment, competitive salaries, and a compensation structure that rewards contribution and hard work. Please click on our link to review our benefits:ZOLL is a fast-growing company that operates in more than 140 countries around the world. Our employees are inspired by a commitment to make a difference in patients' lives, and our culture values innovation, self-motivation and an entrepreneurial spirit. Join us in our efforts to improve outcomes for underserved patients suffering from critical cardiopulmonary conditions and help save more lives.

title: Integration Engineer
job_description: Please note that this position is based on our campus in Madison, WI, and requires relocation to the area. We recruit nationally and provide financial relocation assistance.Make a meaningful impact by creating bridges that improve healthcare.Modern medicine has hundreds of specializations that depend on data from many niche systems to make informed decisions. In Epic's quest to help healthcare providers deliver the highest quality of patient care, we rely on the Integration Engineers on our EDI team to share information across disparate systems and make it easily accessible within a single patient record. Each project this group of experts tackles presents a unique set of challenges; if you enjoy variety, you've found your sweet spot.Your mission use your coding smarts, analytical skills, existing international standards and your breadth of knowledge to figure out ingenious ways to access, convert, and display this data to the end users of Epic's software. Your know-how won't be limited to the technical realm; both Epic and customer teams will look to you to provide sound advice for implementation strategies and project management.You'll make a positive impact from day one as part of a collaborative and committed team of technical peers, and will enjoy opportunities to grow toward your strengths and what interests you most.More than just important work.Epic is located in Madison, Wisconsin, a city regularly ranked as one of America's best places to live. Epic's environment is one of continuous learning; you'll have access to opportunities to expand your skill set and share your knowledge with others. We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. Epic is an Equal Opportunity employer.We seek diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences in our mission to improve healthcare. Research has shown that job-seekers who are women, LGBTQ+, or members of the global majority are less likely to apply for roles they don't seem completely qualified for, so we encourage all who are interested to apply. Please see our full non-discrimination statement at https //careers.epic.com/EEO.Bachelor's or greater in engineering, math, information systems, or a related fieldA history of academic and professional successStrong analytical and reasoning skillsWillingness to travel nationwide 10-25%Eligible to work in the U.S. without visa sponsorshipRelocation to the Madison, WI area (reimbursed)COVID-19 vaccination
Industries: Software Development, Hospitals and Health Care, and Information Technology & Services

title: Field Services Engineer
job_description: Job DesignationThe Field Services Engineer provides significant technical expertise and engineering solutions to customers and sales. Also, resolves a variety of technical issues relative to scheduling, installations, troubleshooting and reporting and works to ensure customer satisfaction through quality of work and service.This position is a critical point of contact with OEM and end-user customers relative to scheduling, execution and reporting of field service activities involving Parker *** Sensing & Monitoring products as well as acting as a technical support resource for Sales.Job Core ResponsibilitiesPerform installations, commissioning and trouble-shooting of Parker *** Sensing & Monitoring hardware and software products and solutions on a wide variety of machine types encountered in the Oil & Gas, Power Generation, Pulp & Paper, and other process industries for OEM and end-user customer.Coordinate different personnel, supervise mechanical and electrical sub-trades, and other groups involved in the fulfillment of the service contracts.Ensures the service is executed in accordance with contractual agreements to assure customer satisfaction through quality and service.Communicates significant technical knowledge effectively and acts as a professional resource for colleagues.Assessment of job site safety.Support Sales, promote Parker *** Sensing & Monitoring products and services and support the growth initiatives of the business.Driving customer satisfaction through problem solving, quality of work and safety.Understand contractual commitments and ensure the service is executed in a timely manner and in accordance with the customer's schedule.Assure service is executed in accordance with the cost allocations that are budgeted, including direct cost and labor hour management.Identify problems and take the initiative to eliminate those problems for project and service event success.Complete installation documentation.Timely completion of standard service reports, invoicing packages, expense reports and other administrative requirements.The primary duties in this job require analysis, interpretation or deductions from facts, available information and data. Requirements involve the comparison and the evaluation of possible results or solutions after considering various possibilities and making recommendations and/or decisions accordingly using professional judgment. Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.Job SpecificationsEducation: Bachelor degree in Electronics or Mechanics or similar Engineering degree requiredYears' Experience: 2+ years of Field Service experience preferredSkillsEnergy and/or Oil & Gas industry experience preferredKnowledge of rotating machinery operation and controls systems preferredFamiliarity with tools including but not limited to: proximity probe test kits, shaker tables, thermocouple calibrator, RTD calibrator, handheld DMM, function generator, power supply, oscilloscope and basic hand tools preferredStrong electronics and mechanical trouble shooting skills; hands-on approach; knowledge of machinist tools and electrical trade; ability to read, interpret, and understand mechanical and electrical printsAbility and willingness to travel (up to 75%) domestically and internationally on a limited basis requiredMust have valid driver license and passportDuring peak seasons may work significant overtimeProficient with computers (including MS Office)Experience Using AutoCAD PreferredFamiliarity with computer network systems preferredDemonstrate authority and assurance dealing with peopleExcellent written and oral communication skills, public presentation and training skills to convey concepts to business and technical personnelEffectively communicate technical opinions and recommendations to customers based on supporting data and analysisSelf-starter with minimal supervision requirement; able to work independently; ability to prioritize, organize work, and meet deadlinesAbility to set and meet aggressive targets and work under stressful working conditions
